ranked_diseases.explanation: All three reference cases with identical phenotypes (obesity, short metacarpals, intellectual disability) were diagnosed with PHP Ia. This is the classic Albright hereditary osteodystrophy phenotype.
PHP Ic presents with similar features to PHP Ia including AHO phenotype (obesity, short metacarpals, intellectual disability) but has different molecular basis involving GNAS mutations.
PPHP presents with AHO features (obesity, short metacarpals, intellectual disability) but without hormone resistance. Cannot exclude without biochemical data.
AHO is the phenotypic constellation seen in PHP Ia and related disorders, characterized by the triad of features present in this patient.
PWS presents with obesity and intellectual disability, and can have small hands/feet which could include short metacarpals, though this is less specific than in PHP.
Cohen syndrome includes obesity and intellectual disability, and can have hand abnormalities, though short metacarpals are not a cardinal feature.
